page.title: 01THE SCENERY OF BALQUHIDDER
page.content: There are a lot of trees in Balquhidder, because most of the landscape is forestry. There are deciduous trees and coniferous trees. The deciduous trees are scattered about and the coniferous are grown in clumps. The land round here is very hilly and quite a few houses are built on the hills. A lot of the landscape belongs to the hill farmers who use it to graze their sheep. The area abounds in wild flowers and in Autumn wild fruits. There is a little tarmac road which winds its way right up the scenic glen to Inverlocharich, passing on the way two lochs, Loch Voil and Loch Doine. From Loch Voil the Balvaig river meanders its way to Loch Lubnaig. Apart from the new forests Balquhidder looks very similar today to what it did 100 years ago.
